IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF NAMI NEW JERSEY (NAMI NJ) IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AFFECTED BY MENTAL ILLNESS THROUGH SUPPORT, EDUCATION AND ADVOCACY. WE STRIVE TO ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING AND ELIMINATE THE STIGMA OFTEN ASSOCIATED WITH MENTAL ILLNESS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: NAMI NEW JERSEY, (NAMI NJ) IS A STATEWIDE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE LIVES OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AFFECTED BY MENTAL ILLNESS. THROUGH SUPPORT, ADVOCACY, AND PUBLIC AWARENESS PROGRAMS NAMI NJ FOSTERS UNDERSTANDING ABOUT MENTAL ILLNESS. WE STRIVE TO ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING AND ELIMINATE THE STIGMA OFTEN ASSOCIATED WITH MENTAL ILLNESS.ON THE STATE LEVEL, NAMI NJ CONFRONTS THE STIGMA OFTEN ASSOCIATED WITH MENTAL DISORDERS, PROMOTES PUBLIC POLICIES THAT BENEFIT THOSE AFFECTED BY MENTAL ILLNESS, AND MONITORS AGENCIES RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROVISION OF MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. AS A LEADER IN THE FIELD OF MENTAL HEALTH AND ILLNESS, NAMI NJ PROMOTES RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSE OF AND TREATMENTS FOR MENTAL ILLNESS, AS A NIMH PARTNER. NAMI NJ PROVIDES SELF-HELP SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES AFFECTED BY MENTAL ILLNESS THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
IRS990.Desc: NAMI NJ WORKS TO SPREAD AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING ABOUT MENTAL ILLNESS TO REMOVE THE STIGMA OFTEN ASSOCIATED WITH THESE ILLNESSES. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED IN MULTIPLE PROGRAMS. NAMI NEW JERSEY PROVIDES A FREE 12-WEEK COURSE FOR FAMILY CAREGIVERS OF INDIVIDUALS WITH SEVERE MENTAL ILLNESS. "FAMILY TO FAMILY" IS TAUGHT BY FELLOW FAMILY CAREGIVERS, TRAINED BY NAMI NJ. THE COURSE DISCUSSES THE DISEASES AND TREATMENTS OF SCHIZOPHRENIA, BIPOLAR DISORDER, MAJOR DEPRESSION, PANIC DISORDER AND OBSESSIVE-COMPULSIVE DISORDER WHILE TEACHES FAMILY MEMBERS COPING SKILLS FOR THEIR CHALLENGING ROLE. THERE WERE MORE THAN 45 FAMILY TO FAMILY CLASSES HELD THROUGHOUT NEW JERSEY THIS YEAR.THROUGH EDUCATION ACTIVITIES, NEWSLETTERS AND CONFERENCES WE PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE LATEST RESEARCH AND AVAILABLE TREATMENTS FOR MENTAL ILLNESS. NAMI NJ HOSTED ITS ANNUAL CONFERENCE IN DECEMBER 2017, WHICH HOSTED MORE THAN 240 INDIVIDUALS. ADDITIONALLY, THE MONTHLY NEWSLETTER REACHES MORE THAN 8,900 INDIVIDUALS EACH MONTH.WE ALSO OFFER EDUCATION FOR MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS AND SCHOOL EDUCATORS ABOUT MENTAL ILLNESS. THE EDUCATING THE EDUCATOR PROGRAM REACHED MORE THAN 600 EDUCATORS.PROVIDING SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE WITH LIVED MENTAL ILLNESS EXPERIENCE, AS WELL AS PROVIDING EDUCATION AND AWARENESS ARE THE IOOV AND HEARTS & MINDS PROGRAMS. LAST YEAR IOOV PROVIDED MORE THAN 170 PRESENTATIONS REACHING NEARLY 1,500 PEOPLE. AN ADDITIONAL 550 PEOPLE RECEIVED PHYSICAL HEALTH INFORMATION THROUGH THE HEARTS & MINDS PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT PROGRAMS: IN LOCAL NAMI NEW JERSEY AFFILIATE SELF-HELP SUPPORT GROUPS, CARING MEMBERS HELP ONE ANOTHER LEARN TO COPE WITH THE EFFECTS OF MENTAL ILLNESS. THEY FIND UNDERSTANDING ACCEPTANCE AND MUTUAL SUPPORT IN TIMES OF CRISIS. NAMI NEW JERSEY OFFERS HOPE, SUPPORT, ADVOCACY, EDUCATION AND A COMMUNITY OF FRIENDS WHO UNDERSTAND. WE ALSO OFFER NAMI CONNECTION SUPPORT GROUPS FOR ADULTS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS IN RECOVERY REGARDLESS OF THE DIAGNOSIS. GROUPS MEET FOR 90 MINUTES AND LED BY TRAINED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE ALSO IN RECOVERY AND UNDERSTAND THE CHALLENGES THEY FACE. NAMI NJ TRAINS FAMILY MEMBERS/CAREGIVERS AND MENTAL HEALTH CONSUMERS IN FACILITATION TECHNIQUES. OVER 1,500 FAMILY MEMBERS AND CONSUMERS PARTICIPATE IN SUPPORT GROUPS THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MENTAL HEALTH OUTREACH PROGRAMS:NAMI NEW JERSEY PROVIDES OUTREACH TO CULTURALLY DIVERSE COMMUNITIES TO HELP THEM UNDERSTAND AND ACCESS MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. SPECIFIC CULTURAL OUTREACH PROGRAMS INCLUDE OUTREACH TO THE CHINESE, SOUTH ASIAN, LATINO AND AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITIES. MORE THAN 150 INDIVIDUALS ARE CURRENT MEMBERS OF THESE MULTICULTURAL OUTREACH PROGRAMS.NAMI NJ MANAGES A STATEWIDE ADVOCACY NETWORK THAT PROVIDES INFORMATION ON SYSTEMS ADVOCACY ISSUES. THE NETWORK PARTICIPATES IN PUBLIC EVENTS; DISTRIBUTES MENTAL HEALTH LITERATURE AND OFFERS COMMUNITY EDUCATION PRESENTATIONS. APPROXIMATELY 5,000 PEOPLE PARTICIPATE IN OUTREACH PROGRAMS OR RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS EACH YEAR. THE NAMI NJ WALK ALSO ACTS AS AN OUTREACH EFFORT. DESPITE TERRIBLE WEATHER, THIS YEAR'S WALK PULLED 1,000 PEOPLE TO STAND UP AND OUT AGAINST STIGMA OF MENTAL ILLNESS. THE NAMI NJ WEBSITE AND CONSTANT CONTACT OUTREACH ARE VIEWED BY MORE THAN 23,000 INDIVIDUALS. NAMI NEW JERSEY WORKS THROUGHOUT THE STATE THROUGH MEMBERS AND AFFILIATES. A MEMBER IS A CONSTITUENT WHO EITHER: HAS A MENTAL ILLNESS, IS A FAMILY MEMBER/FRIEND, OR IS A PERSON DEDICATED TO THE MISSION OF NAMI NJ. AN AFFILIATE IS AN ORGANIZATION LOCATED IN A NJ COUNTY. THESE AFFILIATES PROVIDE INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES, RUN EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND SUPPORT GROUPS, HOST MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS EVENTS AND ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS ADVOCATE AT THE LOCAL AND STATE LEVELS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NAMI NEW JERSEY RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT NAMI NEW JERSEY HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. NAMI NEW JERSEY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR THE FISCAL PERIODS PRIOR TO 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NAMI NEW JERSEY SHALL HAVE TWO CATEGORIES OF MEMBERS: MEMBERS ("MEMBERS") AND, LOCAL AFFILIATES ("AFFILIATES") A. MEMBERS: MEMBER. A PERSON WITH A MENTAL ILLNESS, A RELATIVE OR FRIEND OF A PERSON WITH MENTAL ILLNESS WHO ACCEPTS THE MISSION OF NAMI NEW JERSEY AND NAMI, AND IS A MEMBER OF AN AFFILIATE. B. LOCAL AFFILIATES: AFFILIATE. A GROUP OF FIVE OR MORE MEMBERS WHICH HAS BEEN GRANTED STATUS AS AN AFFILIATE OF NAMI BY THE NAMI BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VOTING MEMBERS OF AFFILIATES CAN NOMINATE AND ELECT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. VOTING MEMBERS SHALL CONSIST OF MEMBERS AND LOCAL AFFILIATES THAT ACCEPT THE MISSION OF NAMI NEW JERSEY AND PAY THE ANNUAL DUES IN THE AMOUNT AND MANNER ESTABLISHED FROM TIME TO TIME FOR VOTING MEMBERS BY RESOLUTION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF NAMI. A. MEMBERS I. MEMBER IS A PERSON WITH A MENTAL ILLNESS, A RELATIVE OR FRIEND OF A PERSON WITH MENTAL ILLNESS WHO ACCEPTS THE MISSION OF NAMI NEW JERSEY AND NAMI, AND IS A MEMBER OF AN AFFILIATE, WHO HAS PAID DUES TO NAMI AND NAMI NEW JERSEY OR AN AFFILIATE FOR WHOM ANNUAL DUES SHALL HAVE BEEN PAID BY ITS AFFILIATE TO NAMI NEW JERSEY AND NAML. A MEMBER MAY BE ONE INDIVIDUAL OR A FAMILY OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN ONE HOUSEHOLD THAT IS COUNTED AS ONE FOR THE PURPOSES OF PAYING DUES AND VOTING. II. MEMBERS SHALL BE VOTING MEMBERS OF AFFILIATES, NOMINATE AND ELECT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF NAMI NEW JERSEY AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE IV, AND ALSO BE THE UNIT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADOPTING AND AMENDING THE BYLAWS OF NAMI NEW JERSEY. III. A MEMBER MAY SUPPORT AND WORK WITHIN SEVERAL AFFILIATES BUT SHALL BE A VOTING MEMBER OF ONLY ONE AFFILIATE FOR NAMI NEW JERSEY PURPOSES. B. AFFILIATES I. AN AFFILIATE SHALL BE A GROUP OF FIVE OR MORE MEMBERS WHICH HAS BEEN GRANTED STATUS AS AN AFFILIATE OF NAMI BY THE NAMI BOARD OF DIRECTORS. II. ALL AFFILIATES WITHIN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY SHALL BECOME MEMBERS OF NAMI NEW JERSEY. III. AN AFFILIATE IN GOOD STANDING SHALL BE DEFMED AS AN AFFLLIATE WHOSE DUES HAVE BEEN PAID TO NAMI NEW JERSEY AND NAMI FOR THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR. A LIST OF MEMBERS OF THE AFFILIATE SHALL ACCOMPANY THE DUES PAYMENT. IV. ALL APPLICATIONS TO NAMI FOR AFFILIATE MEMBERSHIP IN NAMI SHALL BE ENDORSED BY NAMI NEW JERSEY. FAILURE OR REFUSAL OF NAMI NEW JERSEY TO ENDORSE FAVORABLY A MEMBERSHIP APPLICATION OF A PROPOSED AFFILIATE WITHIN 60 DAYS OF THE DATE OF NAMI NEW JERSEY'S RECEIPT OF A COPY OF THE APPLICATION FROM NAMI MAY,AT THE ELECTION OF THE APPLICANT, BE DEEMED TO BE A DISPUTE RESOLVED THROUGH THE PROVISIONS OF ARTICLE IX.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS ARE THE UNIT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ADOPTING AND AMENDING THE BY-LAWS OF NAMI NEW JERSEY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND TREASURER MEET WITH THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR TO PLAN FOR THE ANNUAL AUDIT AND AGAIN TO REVIEW THE AUDIT REPORT. AT A FULL MEETING OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT PRESENTS THE AUDIT REPORT AND ADDRESSES ANY COMMENTS. PRIOR TO THE BOARD MEETING, THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION AT THE FULL BOARD MEETING. THIS PROCESS IS UNCHANGED FROM THE PAST YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS HAVE A DUTY TO AVOID POTENTIAL OR APPARENT CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. TO AVOID THE APPEARANCE OF IMPROPRIETY, IT IS IMPORTANT FOR INDIVIDUALS TO BE OPEN AND HONEST BY COMPLETING THE NAMI NJ DISCLOSURE FORM DISCLOSING: A) WHETHER THEY HAVE A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO ANY TRANSACTION, BUSINESS DECISION OR OTHER MATTERS IN WHICH THE ORGANIZATION IS INVOLVED. B) WHETHER THEY HAVE A FINANCIAL, BUSINESS, OR PERSONAL INTEREST IN AN ENTITY WITH WHICH NAMI NJ IS OR WILL BE DOING BUSINESS. C) WHETHER INDIVIDUALS RELATED TO THEM HAVE A FINANCIAL, BUSINESS, OE PERSONAL INTEREST IN AN ENTITY WITH WHICH NAMI NJ IS OR WILL BE DOING BUSINESS. A TRUSTEE OR OFFICER SAID TO HAVE A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHALL DISCLOSE THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE BOARD. AFTER DISCUSSION WITH THE BOARD HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE BOARD MEETING WHILE A DETERMINATION IS MADE AS TO WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. THE DECISION IS MADE BY A CONSENSUS VOTE OF THE REMAINING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD AND RECORDED IN THE MINUTES. BOARD MEMBERS DECLARING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ABOUT A MATTER SHALL RECUSE HIM/HERSELF FROM ANY DISCUSSION AND ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON THAT MATTER. TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST ACKNOWLEDGEMENT EVERY YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD IS RESPONSBILE TO CONDUCT AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS DETERMINED WITH THE USE OF COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND FORMS 990 OF SIMILIAR ORGANIZATIONS. IN SETTING THE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION, THE BOARD CONSIDERS THE ANNUAL RATE OF INFLATION. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS NOT PRESENT IN THE MEETING WHEN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED. ALL DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS REGARDING COMPENSATION DISCUSSIONS ARE PROPERLY DOCUMENTED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FILE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NAMI NEW JERSEY'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FORM 990, AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST AT 1562 ROUTE 130, NORTH BRUNSWICK, NEW JERSEY 08902, OR BY CALLING DIRECTLY AT (732)940-0991.
